TopicTitle: Reddit user /u/OvenProofMars created multiple star systems in KSP

Articles.Content: OMG! That is amazing! +10 respect for that guy!
Hmm... I am uh... Suspicious to the validity of this for now.

I knew it! I knew there were things beyond the solar system and no one had enough time to check!

Although, I wonder if Squad will say 'throw it in' now. I would actually agree with people saying that "Squad don't do anything unless it's done in a mod first" if that happened.
I'm going to need a bigger rocket...
i really hope nothing like this becomes stock.

i really hope this becomes stock.

Fixed that for you.
I like the idea of multiple solar systems, but I hope that's not how they implement it. Better would be to have the stars each be static like Kerbol and only load one system at a time.
Looks like we're gonna need extra Timewarp and Kraken Repel.

So what you have here is in fact two stars which for the sake of simplicity are planets orbiting a central point of origin, these suns have planets, we'll call them moons. These planet's have moons too, so they'd be moons of moons.

It's not that shocking really

It's not that shocking really

Nobody said it was shockingly new stuff, he was just sharing something really cool.

Its the distance that is shocking for one thing.
